page.title: 04Church, Steeple Bumpstead.
page.content: Some of the church of St. Mary the Virgin dates from the eleventh century.Some of the narrow round topped windows are typical of the period around the{Norman Conquest.} Some of the church was built between 1350 and 1450 in the {Early {Perpendicular}style of architecture. The church is built of brick and flint.Inside there are vaults below the east end of both aisles,and members of the {Gent}family of Moyns Park and the {Bendyshe}family of Bower Hall are buried in them. Stone corbels supporting the main beams of the nave are carved in the form of various heads.There is also some {medieval {graffiti}on the clunch piers in the arcading of the nave. The church has a tower. A folk poem tells of the destruction of the steeple by a storm. {
